Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project in the portfolio.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Project entity.

description.description: A brief description of the project.

systemType.description: The type of system the project is (e.g., Mobile, IoT, Desktop).

techStackIds.description: References to TechStacks. (Relationship: TechStack N:N Project)

TechStack.title: TechStack
TechStack.description: Represents a technology used in the projects.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TechStack entity.

name.description: The name of the technology (e.g., Flutter, Dart, MQTT).

description.description: A brief description of the technology.

ContactMessage.title: ContactMessage
ContactMessage.description: Represents a message received through the contact form.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ContactMessage entity.

name.description: The name of the person sending the message.

email.description: The email address of the person sending the message.

sentAt.description: The date and time when the message was sent.

Branding.title: Branding
Branding.description: Represents the branding information for the website.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Branding entity.

primaryColor.description: The primary color of the website (e.g., Neon Cyan).

backgroundColor.description: The background color of the website (e.g., Deep Space).

accentColor.description: The accent color of the website (e.g., Neon Purple).

bodyFont.description: The font used for the body text (e.g., Inter).

headlineFont.description: The font used for headings (e.g., Space Grotesk).

codeFont.description: The font used for code snippets (e.g., Fira Code).

Bio.title: Bio
Bio.description: Represents the biography information for the architect.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Bio entity.

title.description: The title of the architect (e.g., Flutter & IoT Systems Architect).

description.description: A detailed description of the architect's skills and experience.

avatarUrl.description: URL to the architect's avatar image.

showGamesSection.description: Whether to show the games section on the homepage.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the Cyber Architect portfolio website's CMS needs, focusing on authorization independence, clarity, and security. The structure uses structural segregation to group data with similar access requirements. It also denormalizes authorization data to avoid `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations. The structure includes collections for projects, tech stacks, contact messages, branding, and bio information. The design emphasizes flat collections to optimize querying and simplify security rules, as well as enabling secure list operations (QAPs).
